results.title: Ruth Stout's garden
results.brief_description: A revealing portrait of a charming individualist illustrating that age need not be a barrier to continued productivity and creativity. Ruth Stout, now in her tenth decade, remains active writing books, contributing regularly to periodicals, lecturing and perfecting her ‘no dig/no work’ method of gardening.

results.title: Environment: the British example - a German view = London so long, smog
results.creator_credit: Fritz Gebhardt, Rudolf Rosthof and NDR TV
results.brief_description: In 1952 4,000 people died as a result of “smog”, a mixture of natural fog, soot and smoke, containing poisonous waste gases. The ensuing Clean Air Act designated smokeless zones and all soft coal fires were banned in London. Shows how inspectors keep a close watch on domestic and industrial air pollution, so that smog is a thing of the past.
results.title_for_label: Environment: the British example - a German view = London so long, smog

results.title: The School is not an island
results.creator_credit: Chris Noonan, Malcolm Otton, Timothy Read and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A group of students from Sunshine North Technical School in Melbourne, Victoria, attempt to start their own coffee shop as part of a community involvement program, and discover much about their ability to control their lives.

results.title: Strategy for survival: behavioural ecology of the monarch butterfly (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Offers a look at the nature of the behavioral and ecological interactions characteristic of life and focuses on the migratory and mating behavior of the monarch butterfly as well as on its ability to take over the chemical defense system of its food. Presents naturalistic observations and also demonstrates controlled experiments.

Episode of Series “Sports training film series”.

results.title: 34 years after Hitler
results.creator_credit: William K McClure and CBS News
results.brief_description: Looks at neo-Nazi groups in Germany today that have been known to destroy Jewish cemeteries, paint swastikas on the street and distribute anti-Semitic propaganda. While not viewed as a flourishing movement on the verge of popular acceptance, the neo-Nazis are shown to be a group whose philosophy and immediate predecessors demand that their activities be put into proper perspective.
results.description: Looks at neo-Nazi groups in Germany today that have been known to destroy Jewish cemeteries, paint swastikas on the street and distribute anti-Semitic propaganda.
